Original: Be very careful of the [Color:5]tornadoes[Color:0] you
come across. Come into contact with
one, and you'll lose all your food...
[Page]
The loss of food before anyone has had
a chance to taste it is a tragedy no
one should have to bear.
[Page]
Better to throw it to the [Color:5]kangaroos[Color:0]
wandering the land! They enjoy
[Color:5]vegetables[Color:0], I happen to know.
[Page]
[Color:6][Item:2069][Color:0]s don't have any other use
but to lure those kangaroos anyway.
You can even scatter them as bait.
Translation: Be very careful of the [Color:5]tornadoes[Color:0] you
come across. Come into contact with
one, and you'll lose all your food...
[Page]
The loss of food before anyone has had
a chance to taste it is a tragedy no
one should have to bear.
[Page]
Better to throw it to the [Color:5]kangaroos[Color:0]
wandering the land! They enjoy
[Color:5]vegetables[Color:0], I happen to know.
[Page]
[Color:6][Item:2069][Color:0]s don't have any other use
but to lure those kangaroos anyway.
You can even scatter them as bait.

Original: It looks like you've made it to the
Scarlet Pillars. It's a wonderful
place... Lots of good food there.
[Page]
But the monsters that wander the land
find it just as delicious. Don't go
trying to take their food from them.
[Page]
Especially the [Color:5]mushroom[Color:0]-loving [Color:5]sheep[Color:0]
and the [Color:5]mantises[Color:0], who are fond of
[Color:5]birds and fish[Color:0]. They'll come running.
[Page]
Though from another perspective, you
could use that to guide the monsters.
Though I wouldn't recommend it...
